result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Myles Jeremy Kovac not in court.  
Attorney Francesco Mineo appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case calendared for a Status of Counsel. 
Court advised defendant the State Public Defender Office need additional time to appoint counsel.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Myles Jeremy Kovac appeared by video.  
Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Status of Counsel. 
Defendant informed the SPD has not been appointed counsel as of today's date.
State public defender contacted by email regarding status of counsel and  informed of defendant demand for speedy trial. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Myles Jeremy Kovac in court, in custody.  Attorney Eugene James Dietzler Esq in court for Myles Jeremy Kovac.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel's motion to withdraw as counsel for reasons stated on the record heard and granted by the court.   Defendant's demand for speedy trial remains.  Attorney Dietzler to inform the SPD office to appoint new counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 19.  Court removed the 10/17/2022 jury trial date from the court's calendar.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE SPUNNED TO BRANCH 37 FOR BRANCH 19
TO ADDRESS DEFENSE MOTION TO WITHDRAW.
Defense Motion to Withdraw as counsel of record.
Received and Filed: Defense Motion to Withdraw and Terminate representation.
Received and Filed: Defense Motion to Withdraw, forwarded to the Judge.

Attorney Eugene James Dietzler in court, defendant Myles Jeremy Kovac not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a scheduling Conference.Defense request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19. Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, room 313 of the courthouse.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND- EXPIRES  11-14-2022.

Defendant Myles Jeremy Kovac in court with Attorney Eugene James Dietzler.  Defendant Myles Jeremy Kovac in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Detective A. Cerqua. Court took judicial notice of 11CF5195. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.    
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Myles Jeremy Kovac not in court, defendant in custody. Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing at 8:30am. Case called at 4:52pm. Parties were present prior to the case being called on the record; due to Court congestion Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eugene James Dietzler in court, defendant Myles Jeremy Kovac not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Kietzler has been appointed.  This matter is adjourned for preliminary hearing/bail hearing.   mn  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
bail reduction, Filed.
in-person appearance in court, Filed.

SPD Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

Defendant Myles Jeremy Kovac not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.  State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is GRANTED. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a STATE V-LEE hearing in the trial court. Date provided by Branch 45 clerk.  Hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Myles Jeremy Kovac not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Myles Jeremy Kovac not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
with LJB, JEV, NAD and DAV

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring: no contact order.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.   The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY with breathlyzer and drug testing. 
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Myles Jeremy Kovac in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Myles Jeremy Kovac in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Myles Jeremy Kovac appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
